name: AmazonEC2
description: Amazon Elastic Cloud Compute - compute capacity in the cloud

params.name: accessKeyId
params.description: AWS Access Key ID to use for authentication

params.name: secretAccessKey
params.description: AWS Secret Access Key to use for authentication

settings.name: region
settings.description: AWS Region to use by default

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: IMAGE_ID
params.description: An AMI is a template that contains the software configuration (operating system, application server, and applications) required to launch an instance.

params.name: INSTANCE_TYPE
params.description: Instance type determines quantity and type of computing, memory, networking, and disk resources made available to the instance.

params.name: KEY_NAME
params.description: Key pair name determines which private .pem or .ppk key may be used to access the new instance.

params.name: SECURITY_GROUP_IDS
params.description: Security Groups act as firewall rules, determining which sorts of network traffic are allowed in and out of the instance. Specify one per line.

params.name: USER_DATA
params.description: User data is a command or script that is automatically run after the instance is launched.

params.name: MIN_COUNT
params.description: Minimum number of instances to launch, if launching more than one

params.name: MAX_COUNT
params.description: Maximum number of instances to launch, if launching more than one

params.name: subnetId
params.description: The subnet on which the new instance will be networked

params.name: NAME_TAG
params.description: Optionally specify the "Name" tag of the new instance.

params.name: rootVolumeSize
params.description: The size of the root volume in GiB

params.name: TAGS_SPECIFICATION
params.description: Optional tags to apply to the resources during launch, as Key=Value pairs, one per line

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: INSTANCE_IDS
params.description: The IDs of the instances to start, one per line

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: INSTANCE_IDS
params.description: The IDs of the instances to stop, one per line

params.name: WAIT_FOR_STOP
params.description: Wait for the specified instances to stop completely before continuing with pipeline

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: INSTANCE_IDS
params.description: The IDs of the instances to reboot, one per line

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: INSTANCE_IDS
params.description: The IDs of the instances to TERMINATE, one per line

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: INSTANCE_IDS
params.description: Optional IDs of specific instances to describe, one per line. If empty all instances may be described.

params.name: filters
params.description: Optional array of filters to select specific instances

params.name: DRYRUN
params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.name: GET_ALL_RECURSIVELY
params.description: If enabled, retrieves all results instead of only the first 1000 instances.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: instanceIds
params.description: The IDs of the instances to modify, one per line

params.name: instanceType
params.description: Instance type determines quantity and type of computing, memory, networking, and disk resources made available to the instance.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: instanceIds
params.description: The IDs of the instances to modify, one per line

params.name: attributeValue
params.description: A new value for the attribute

params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: KEY_PAIR_NAME
params.description: A name for the new key pair.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: KEY_PAIR_NAME
params.description: The name of the key pair to delete.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: ADDRESS
params.description: The Elastic IP address to recover or an IPv4 address from an address pool.

params.name: PUBLICIPV4POOL
params.description: The ID of an address pool that you own. Use this parameter to let Amazon EC2 select an address from the address pool. To specify a specific address from the address pool, use the Address parameter instead.

params.name: DRYRUN
params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: ALLOCATION_ID
params.description: The elastic IP allocation to be associated

params.name: INSTANCE_ID
params.description: ID of an instance if associating to an EC2 instance

params.name: NETWORK_INTERFACE_ID
params.description: ID of an interface if associating to an elastic network interface

params.name: PRIVATE_IP_ADDRESS
params.description: A private IP address if associating with an IP address

params.name: DRYRUN
params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: ALLOCATION_ID
params.description: The elastic IP allocation to be released

params.name: DRYRUN
params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: cidrBlock
params.description: The IPv4 network range for the VPC, in CIDR notation

params.name: amazonProvidedIpv6CidrBlock
params.description: Requests an Amazon-provided IPv6 CIDR block with a /56 prefix length for the VPC. The range of IP addresses and size of the CIDR block cannot be specified.

params.name: instanceTenancy
params.description: Tenancy defines how EC2 instances are distributed across physical hardware and affects pricing. Dedicated Instances are Amazon EC2 instances that run in a VPC on hardware that's dedicated to a single customer.

params.name: createInternetGateway
params.description: Create an Internet gateway and attach it the new VPC

params.name: tags
params.description: Optional tags to apply to AWS resources, as Key or Key=Value pairs, one per line

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: vpcId
params.description: The ID of the VPC to delete

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: vpcId
params.description: The ID of the VPC in which the subnet is to be created

params.name: routeTableId
params.description: An optional existing route table ID to which the subnet should be associated

params.name: availabilityZone
params.description: The availablility zone of the subnet - must be one within the specified region, commonly region ID + a, b, or c

params.name: cidrBlock
params.description: The IPv4 network range for the VPC, in CIDR notation. Must fall within range of VPC CIDR block.

params.name: ipv6CidrBlock
params.description: The IPv6 network range for the subnet, in CIDR notation. The subnet size must use a /64 prefix length and fall within range of the VPC CIDR block.

params.name: outpostArn
params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost. If you specify an Outpost ARN, you must also specify the Availability Zone of the Outpost subnet.

params.name: allocationId
params.description: The allocation ID of an Elastic IP address to associate with the NAT gateway, to create and associate a NAT Gateway with the subnet

params.name: createPrivateRouteTable
params.description: Creates a new route table and associates it with the subnet

params.name: mapPublicIpOnLaunch
params.description: Enables the auto-assign IP settings to automatically request a public IPv4 address for interfaces on the new subnet

params.name: tags
params.description: Optional tags to apply to AWS resources, as Key or Key=Value pairs, one per line

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: subnetId
params.description: The ID of the subnet to Delete.

params.name: routeTableId
params.description: The ID of the route table in which to create a route

params.name: gatewayId
params.description: Optional internet gateway to serve as the target of the route, if not NAT gateway or instance

params.name: natGatewayId
params.description: Optional NAT Gateway to serve as the target of the route, if not internet gateway or instance

params.name: instanceId
params.description: Optional Instance ID to serve as the target of the route, if not internet or NAT gateway

params.name: destinationCidrBlock
params.description: CIDR block notation of IP address range of the new route

params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.description: The VPC in which to create a new route table

params.description: Optional subnet to associate with the new route table

params.name: gatewayId
params.description: Optional internet gateway to be the target of the default route in the new route table

params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.name: routeTableId
params.description: The ID of the route table to associate

params.name: subnetId
params.description: Optional subnet ID to associate the route table with a subnet

params.name: gatewayId
params.description: Optional internet gateway ID to make default route target internet gateway

params.name: DryRun
params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: availabilityZone
params.description: Availability zone in which to create the volume

params.name: volumeType
params.description: Volume type selection affects disk throughput rate and cost for the volume. Type gp3 is recommended for cost-effective storage for general workloads.

params.name: size
params.description: Optional size of the volume, in GiB. If using a snapshot must be equal or larger than snapshot size.

params.name: iops
params.description: For Types io1, io2, and gp3, specify number of I/O operations per second (IOPS). 3000 is the baseline minimum for gp3 volumes.

params.name: snapshotId
params.description: Optional snapshot may be specified to determine size and content of new volume

params.name: outpostArn
params.description: If specified create the volume on the outpost specified.

params.name: throughput
params.description: Optional throughput for gp3, st1, and sc1 volume types only, in MiB/s. 125 MiB/s is the baseline minimum for gp3.

params.name: encrypted
params.description: Enable to encrypt volume with specified KMS Key ID

params.name: kmsKeyId
params.description: ID of a Key Management Service (KMS) key to use for Amazon EBS encryption

params.name: multiAttachEnabled
params.description: Option to enable Amazon EBS Multi-Attach for volumes types io1 and io2 only

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.name: waitForEnd
params.description: Wait for volume to become available before continuing with pipeline

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: volumeId
params.description: The ID of the volume for which to create a snapshot

params.name: description
params.description: A description for the snapshot

params.name: outpostArn
params.description: If specified, create the snapshot on the outpost specified.

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.name: waitForEnd
params.description: Wait for completed snapshot to become available before continuing with pipeline

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: name
params.description: Name for new security group

params.name: description
params.description: A description for the new security group
params.placeholder: Allows web traffic on TCP ports 80, 443, and 8080-8090

params.name: vpcId
params.description: ID of the VPC in which the security group is to be created

params.name: tags
params.description: Optional tags to apply to AWS resources, as Key or Key=Value pairs, one per line

params.name: disallowOutboundTraffic
params.description: Remove from the security group the default rule that allows all outbound traffic

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: groupId
params.description: The ID of the security group to which rules are to be added

params.name: ruleType
params.description: The type of security group rule to create

params.name: cidrIps
params.description: CIDR notation IPv4 address range(s) to be used as the source range for ingress or destination range for egress rules. Use "0.0.0.0/0" to match all IP addresses.

params.name: cidrIps6
params.description: The CIDR notation IPv6 address range(s) to be used as the source range for ingress or destination range for egress rules. Use "::/0" to match all IP addresses.

params.name: portRanges
params.description: Range(s) of ports to authorize (or revoke) for the security group rule

params.name: ipProtocol
params.description: The protocol to which the rule is to apply

params.name: icmpType
params.description: If specified protocol is ICMP, optionally select a specific type to target with this rule.

params.name: description
params.description: Description for the new rule

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: resourceId
params.description: AWS ID of the EC2 resource to tag

params.name: tags
params.description: Tags to apply to AWS resources, as Key or Key=Value pairs, one per line
